title: Hyrum's Law in Golang
dot:
digraph hyrums_law{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Helvetica"];edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];HyrumsLaw[label="Hyrum's Law

With a sufficient number of users of an API, all observable behaviors
will be depended on by somebody.", shape=rect, width=3.5];CodeExample[label="Code Example

'http: request body too large' error message can't be changed due to Hyrum's Law.", shape=rect];GoCodebase[label="Go Codebase

Go code examples that reference Hyrum's Law: crypto/rsa, internal/weak", shape=rect];Observation[label="Observation

This law applies beyond Go, seen in multiple languages & frameworks.
Also, similar to JavaScript quirks.", shape=rect];HyrumsLaw->CodeExample[label="Affects API Design", color=green];HyrumsLaw->GoCodebase[label="Reflected in Go Code", color=green];GoCodebase->Observation[label="Wider Implications", color=blue];MaxBytesError[label="MaxBytesError Error Message

'http: request body too large' is a stable error message.
Changing it could break dependent systems.", shape=ellipse, width=3.2];EncryptOAEP[label="EncryptOAEP

Acknowledges that certain behaviors, like random streams, are relied upon,
due to Hyrum's Law.", shape=ellipse];SignPSS[label="SignPSS

Similar recognition that non-deterministic execution may be relied upon.
Changing this behavior could affect users.", shape=ellipse];WeakPointer[label="Weak Pointer

Risk of exposing functionality leading to locked-in semantics.
Hyrum's Law could make changes difficult.", shape=ellipse];GoCodebase->MaxBytesError[label="MaxBytesError", color=red];GoCodebase->EncryptOAEP[label="EncryptOAEP", color=red];GoCodebase->SignPSS[label="SignPSS", color=red];GoCodebase->WeakPointer[label="Weak Pointer", color=red];Observation->"Hyrum's Law Applies Globally"[label="Global Phenomenon", color=purple];Observation->"JavaScript's Evolution"[label="JavaScript's Quirks", color=purple];FinalThoughts[label="Final Thoughts

- Be careful when changing code others rely on.
- Design systems to minimize unintended behaviors.
- Avoid locking in quirks.", shape=rect, width=3.5];Observation->FinalThoughts[label="Guidance", color=orange];rankdir=TB;labelloc="t";label="Hyrum's Law in Go Codebase";}
